meanings.definition: To charge a toll for passage through a gate or barrier.
meanings.sent1: The old bridge tollgated travelers for crossing the river.
meanings.sent2: The highway authority tollgated drivers at the entrance to the city.
meanings.sent3: The tollgate operator playfully tollgated every car with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The tollbooth acted as a tollgate, tollgating all vehicles for entry.
meanings.sent5: The tollgate's purpose was clear as it tollgated each passing vehicle.

meanings.sent1: The tollgated highway made sure to collect fees from all drivers.
meanings.sent2: The tollgated entrance to the park required payment for entry.
meanings.sent3: The tollgated road was always busy with cars coming and going.
meanings.sent4: The tollgated area was well-maintained and organized for efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The tollgated section of the highway was marked clearly for drivers.

meanings.sent1: The tollgated travelers had to stop and pay before continuing.
meanings.sent2: The tollgated vehicles lined up to pass through the checkpoint.
meanings.sent3: The tollgated road was a reminder of the cost of travel.
meanings.sent4: The tollgated area was monitored to ensure all payments were made.
meanings.sent5: The tollgated section of the highway slowed down traffic during peak hours.
